name: Hungarian Lentil Soup
author: Gabriella
summary: This lentil soup is of a Hungarian based recipe and it is traditional to eat lentils during New Years day to symbolize money coming your way for the coming year.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups lentils - soaked, rinsed and drained
directions: In a large stockpot, saute the onions in oil until they are glossy
Stir in garlic, paprika, celery, carrots, and saute for 10 minutes
Once the vegetables have sauteed for 10 minutes stir in tomatoes, chicken stock, lentils, bay leaves, salt, and pepper
Stir well, then add the wine and bring the mixture to a boil
Slowly reduce the heat and cook for 1 hour on low to medium heat; or until the lentils are tender
Sprinkle the soup with parsley and Parmesan (optional)  before serving
